comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: As a Limerick man who has always had to endure the guys from the swamp giving themselves airs and at the same time calling themselves the Rebels this is manna from heaven!  Look at REBEL Cork then and now?  Union Jacks all over the place, licking up to royalty like serfs, Rebels me eyeball!  That poor lady is a Kerry woman who can't wait to get out of the place. (Written with tongue firmly fixed to cheek!)

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Cork is nicknamed "The Rebel County", as a result of the support of the townsmen of Cork in 1491 for Perkin Warbeck, a pretender to the throne of England during the Wars of the Roses. In 1491 Cork played a part in the English Wars of the Roses when Perkin Warbeck a pretender to the English throne, landed in the city and tried to recruit support for a plot to overthrow Henry VII of England. The mayor of Cork and several important citizens went with Warbeck to England but when the rebellion collapsed they were all captured and executed. Cork's nickname of the 'rebel city' originates in these events.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Well, I did acknowledge in the description that Cork is the Real Capital of Ireland! Don't want to get any Corkonians riled up.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] 
My paper driving licence said "Tear along the dotted line" and that's the way I used to drive.
The running woman bears a strong resemblance to Old Mother Riley, as played by Arthur Lucan (or was it Lord Lucan?)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Ha!  Old Mother Riley teaching her grandchildren to cross the road in Patrick Street, Cork - "Look right for horses, look left for horses, look right again for the tram, look left again for the other tram, look right yet again for the carts,  look left yet again for the other carts ... and then run like the blazes ... !"

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content:
I was in Cork over the past weekend.
Whoever is responsible for the hideous street lamps should be hung from one of them.
Hated them when they first installed them, and hate them even more now.
They have not aged well, and will continue to look like something left over from a building site.
Bring back the classic street furniture !
